articles.author: Emma Teitel - City Columnist
articles.title: Emma Teitel: So you got Pfizer first and Moderna second? That’s OK, experts say: your body doesn’t recognize brand names
articles.description: Doctors are racking their brains for analogies to convince people that mixing vaccines is safe. This has got to stop, says Emma Teitel. The important part is to get two doses without delay. Mix and match Pfizer and Moderna if that’s what’s available to you.
articles.content: Has anything been analogized more than the Pfizer and Moderna vaccines? At a news conference Wednesday morning, the city’s top doctor, Eileen de Villa, reassured Torontonians that both mRNA vaccines … [+4953 chars]

articles.author: Nicholas Keung - Immigration Reporter
articles.title: How Canada is moving to end the systemic ‘environmental racism’ that has been the toxic burden of racialized and Indigenous people for decades
articles.description: Both Canada and the U.S. are taking action against the environmental injustice that has seen racialized and Indigenous peoples bear the toxic burden of industry and municipalities
articles.content:
Lounging on the deck of her family home in a rural town in Nova Scotia, Louise Delisle no longer has to bear the view of the dump site behind the now overgrown birch and fir trees.

articles.author: Saumya Tewari
articles.title: Suba Group acquires leisure hospitality chain 1589 Hotels
articles.description: Owned and run by Clarks Group of Hotels, 1589 Hotels was set up as a separate division under which hotel and resort properties were being run on a management contract basis
articles.content: NEW DELHI: Mumbai-based hospitality firm, the Suba Group, which operates in the mid-tier segment, has acquired a controlling stake in the leisure budget hospitality chain, 1589 Hotels. The developmen… [+3040 chars]

articles.title: Tourists Throng Himachal As Plains Reel Under Heatwave, Covid Cases Decline
articles.description: Tourists have been thronging Himachal Pradesh as the heatwave has hit the plains and the second wave of COVID-19 seeing a significant decline in the country.

articles.title: No Risk For Kids Born To Mothers Given Flu Jabs During Pregnancy: Study
articles.description: A population-based study, published in the Journal of the American Medical Association (JAMA), has found flu vaccination during pregnancy does not lead to an increased risk of adverse early childhood health outcomes.
articles.content:
Safety concerns are a reason people may not get influenza jabs during pregnancy (Representational)
